Question: Which of the following statements is correct about Scratch damage?
Option A: Scratch is damage to a surface caused by scuffing, rubbing or scraping of the component. Fibres are not damaged and mechanical performance is not affected.
Option B: Scratch is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an adhesive failure
Option C: Scratch is the result of contact with a sharp object and only surface fibres are affected and the edges are sharp
Correct Answer: Scratch is the result of contact with a sharp object and only surface fibres are affected and the edges are sharp

Question: Which of the following statements is correct about Abrasion damage?
Option A: Abrasion is damage to a surface caused by scuffing, rubbing or scraping of the component. Fibres are not damaged and mechanical performance is not affected.
Option B: Abrasion is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an adhesive failure
Option C: Abrasion is the result of contact with a sharp object and only surface fibres are affected and the edges are sharp
Correct Answer: Abrasion is damage to a surface caused by scuffing, rubbing or scraping of the component. Fibres are not damaged and mechanical performance is not affected.

Question: Which of the following statements is correct about Debonding damage?
Option A: Debonding is damage to a surface caused by scuffing, rubbing or scraping of the component. Fibres are not damaged and mechanical performance is not affected.
Option B: Debonding is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an adhesive failure
Option C: Debonding is the result of contact with a sharp object and only surface fibres are affected and the edges are sharp
Correct Answer: Debonding is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an adhesive failure

Question: Which of the following statements is correct about Lightning Strike damage?
Option A: The effect of a lightning strike depends on the material will not be the same. For non- conductive materials like Glass- and Aramid Fibre a large part of the component, if not completely protected, may be blown out because both skins are affected and the core generally vapourised due to the extreme heat
Option B: Lightning strike is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an adhesive failure
Option C: Lightning strike is when the separation of plies occurs in a multi-laminate material. This can be caused by the material being hit (impact delamination), or when there is a resin failure for any other reason.
Correct Answer: The effect of a lightning strike depends on the material will not be the same. For non- conductive materials like Glass- and Aramid Fibre a large part of the component, if not completely protected, may be blown out because both skins are affected and the core generally vapourised due to the extreme heat

Question: Which of the following statements is correct about Delamination damage?
Option A: Delamination is a deformity caused by extraneous forces, which are applied to the structure. This can be an impact (FO
Option B: Delamination is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an adhesive failure
Option C: Delamination is when the separation of plies occurs in a multi-laminate material. This can be caused by the material being hit (impact delamination), or when there is a resin failure for any other reason.
Correct Answer: Delamination is when the separation of plies occurs in a multi-laminate material. This can be caused by the material being hit (impact delamination), or when there is a resin failure for any other reason.

Question: Which of the following statements is correct about Dent damage?
Option A: A dent is a deformity caused by extraneous forces, which are applied to the structure. This can be an impact (FO
Option B: A dent is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an adhesive failure
Option C: A dent is when the separation of plies occurs in a multi-laminate material. This can be caused by the material being hit (impact delamination), or when there is a resin failure for any other reason.
Correct Answer: A dent is a deformity caused by extraneous forces, which are applied to the structure. This can be an impact (FO

Question: Which of the following statements is correct about Erosion damage?
Option A: Erosion is the result of contact with a sharp object and only surface fibres are affected and the edges are sharp.
Option B: Erosion could affect all the leading edge surfaces, especially when the initial surface protection system has been damaged. Erosion, when undetected or unrepaired, may generate composite deterioration.
Option C: Erosion principally affects the resin and is generally due to accidental contact with aggressive chemical liquids or products (e.g. hydraulic fluid).
Correct Answer: Erosion could affect all the leading edge surfaces, especially when the initial surface protection system has been damaged. Erosion, when undetected or unrepaired, may generate composite deterioration.

Question: Which of the following statements is correct about Chemical Degradation damage?
Option A: Chemical degradation is the result of contact with a sharp object, only surface fibres are affected and the edges are sharp.
Option B: Chemical degradation could affect all the leading edge surfaces. Chemical degradation, when undetected or unrepaired, may generate composite deterioration.
Option C: Chemical degradation principally affects the resin and is generally due to accidental contact with aggressive chemical liquids or products (e.g. hydraulic fluid).
Correct Answer: Chemical degradation principally affects the resin and is generally due to accidental contact with aggressive chemical liquids or products (e.g. hydraulic fluid).

Question: What testing methods can detect the presence of debonding and delamination damages?
Option A: Tap Testing, Visual or optical inspection

Question: Which of the following statements is correct about Tap testing?
Option A: Tap testing is only capable of finding flaws that are evident on the visible surface. Internal flaws in composites (such as delamination, disbonding and matrix crazing) are not detectable. In addition, tight surface cracks and edge delamination may not be detectable.
Option B: Tap testing is extremely sensitive in measuring small surface defects. The part to be inspected is stressed by the application of heat, a static load or vibration to bring out the effect of the flaw on the surface displacement
Option C: Tap testing is widely used for the quick evaluation of any accessible aircraft surfaces to detect presence of debonding or entrapped water.
Correct Answer: Tap testing is widely used for the quick evaluation of any accessible aircraft surfaces to detect presence of debonding or entrapped water.

Question: Which of the following statements is correct about Radiography testing?
Option A: Radiography is only capable of finding flaws that are evident on the visible surface.
Option B: The part to be inspected by radiography is stressed by the application of heat, a static load or vibration to bring out the effect of the flaw on the surface displacement.
Option C: Radiography is a NDT technique that uses X−rays or gamma rays.
Correct Answer: Radiography is a NDT technique that uses X−rays or gamma rays.

Question: Which of the following statements is correct about Ultrasonics testing?
Option A: Ultrasonic waves travel through solids and liquids at relatively high speeds, but are rapidly attenuated in gasses. The density and the elasticity of the medium may affect the wave speed.
Option B: The part to be inspected by ultrasonics is stressed by the application of heat, a static load or vibration to bring out the effect of the flaw on the surface displacement.
Option C: Ultrasonics is a NDT technique that uses X−rays or gamma rays.
Correct Answer: Ultrasonic waves travel through solids and liquids at relatively high speeds, but are rapidly attenuated in gasses. The density and the elasticity of the medium may affect the wave speed.

Question: What are the typical of repairs on Composite parts?
Option C: Injection repair, repair of edges and repair of coverings, honeycombs
Correct Answer: Injection repair, repair of edges and repair of coverings, honeycombs

Question: Which of the following statements is correct about Repair through Injection of Resin?
Option A: Repair through Injection of Resin is recommended for small damages of the honeycomb material. The area is filled with thickened resin/hardener alloy and in the next step made plane. However, the repaired area has lost nearly the half of its original strength.
Option B: The repair through injection of resin is an approved repair for delamination or dissolving adhesives. If the damaged is caused by contamination or water absorption, this type of repair is not recommended.
Option C: Repair through Injection of Resin is typical for sandwich structures. It is easy to accomplish especially if the damaged parts are very small. Today two different repairs of sandwich parts can be accomplished: Repair of the covering, if only one side of the covering and/or parts of the combs are damaged; Repair of the covering, if both covering parts and the combs are damaged
Correct Answer: The repair through injection of resin is an approved repair for delamination or dissolving adhesives. If the damaged is caused by contamination or water absorption, this type of repair is not recommended.

Today two different repairs of sandwich parts can be accomplished: Repair of the covering, if only one side of the covering and/or parts of the combs are damaged; Repair of the covering, if both covering parts and the combs are damaged
Correct Answer: Filling Repair Resin is recommended for small damages of the honeycomb material. The area is filled with thickened resin/hardener alloy and in the next step made plane. However, the repaired area has lost nearly the half of its original strength.

Question: What are the effects of the Perforated Parting Film?
Option A: To prevent the bagging materials sticking to the repair surface. The film is perforated with small holes to allow air and gases to escape from the repair piles. Some resin will escape through the holes so, for repair, it is best to choose a film with pin-pricks to reduce the resin loss. Perforated parting film will produce a shiny, resin-rich surface on the repair.
Option B: To help even-out the temperature over the entire repair, help even-out the pressure over the whole repair and improve the flatness of the surface of the repair.
Option C: To allow the air and gases to escape easily
Correct Answer: To prevent the bagging materials sticking to the repair surface. The film is perforated with small holes to allow air and gases to escape from the repair piles. Some resin will escape through the holes so, for repair, it is best to choose a film with pin-pricks to reduce the resin loss. Perforated parting film will produce a shiny, resin-rich surface on the repair.

Question: Basically, what is corrosion?

Correct Answer: Because it has no obvious signs on the surface of the metal so it is difficult to detect. In addition, the corrosion extends in the vertical direction so it reduces material strength
